meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tart or sour in taste.
meanings.sent1: The tartinesses of the lemonade made my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the tartinesses of green apples.
meanings.sent3: The tartinesses of the vinegar in the salad dressing added a zesty kick.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words had a tartinesses that left a bitter taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The tartinesses of the grapefruit was so intense, it made me squint.

meanings.definition: The act of being late or delayed in a disrespectful or impolite manner.
meanings.sent1: Her constant tartinesses to meetings annoyed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The professor was not pleased with the student's tartinesses in submitting assignments.
meanings.sent3: His tartinesses to the party made him miss out on all the fun.
meanings.sent4: The train's tartinesses caused many passengers to miss their connections.
meanings.sent5: The flight attendant scolded the passenger for their tartinesses in boarding the plane.
